data.enText: a sudden event that causes many people to suffer

data.chText: 提前发出的洪水水位上涨警报防止了又一次的重大灾害。
data.enText: Early warnings of rising water levels prevented another major catastrophe.
an event that causes one person or a group of people personal suffering, or that makes difficulties

data.chText: 扩展业务的尝试使这家公司陷入困境。
data.enText: The attempt to expand the business was a catastrophe for the firm.

data.chText: 我们为聚会准备食物时遇到了一些困难。
data.enText: We've had a few catastrophes with the food for the party.

data.chText: 灾难性的影响 / 损失 / 结果
要花费巨资治疗的疾病
data.enText: a catastrophic illness (= one that costs a very large amount to treat)

ex.chText: 母亲的突然去世对全家是一个极大的不幸。
ex.enText: Mother's sudden death was a tragedy to the family.

ex.chText: 他提到的那一悲惨事件发生在3月。
ex.enText: The tragedy he mentioned took place in March.

ex.chText: 地震中悲剧发生了，一家人中有四个丧命。
ex.enText: The tragedy occurred during the earthquake when four people of the same family were killed.

synonyms.bx: 指因有人死亡而令人震惊的不幸事件。

ex.chText: 他面对逆境的勇气极大地鼓舞了其他人。
ex.enText: The others were greatly inspired by his courage in the face of adversity.

ex.chText: 他时刻准备着去应对逆境。
ex.enText: He is always ready to deal with adversity.

synonyms.bx: 指困难重重或不走运的境况。

ex.chText: 如果雨一直下个不停，将会给农民带来灾难。
ex.enText: It will be a calamity for farmers if it keeps raining.

ex.chText: 洪水给当地民众带来了巨大灾难。
ex.enText: The flood brought calamities to the local people.

ex.chText: 事实证明这桩婚姻是她一生中最大的不幸。
ex.enText: The marriage proved to be the greatest calamity of her life.

ex.chText: 这次英语考试我要是通不过就惨了。
ex.enText: It will be a calamity if I fail my English exam.

synonyms.bx: 指意外发生的、造成重大损失的灾祸，语气强于 disaster，侧重于悲痛的心情；有时也指个人的不幸， 多为幽默用语。

ex.chText: 急需食物以避免一场人道主义灾难。
ex.enText: Food is required immediately to avert a humanitarian catastrophe.

ex.chText: 那场森林火灾是个大灾难。
ex.enText: The forest fire was a catastrophe.

ex.chText: 这场自然灾害给该国经济带来了严重的打击。
ex.enText: The natural catastrophe dealt a heavy blow to this country's economy.

ex.chText: 如果该项目取消，对所有相关公司将是个灾难。
ex.enText: If the project is cancelled, it will be a catastrophe for all of the companies concerned.

synonyms.bx: 语气最强，指造成破坏、死亡的可怕灾难，强调最终的结局；也可指极为麻烦的局面或悲惨的结局。

ex.chText: 飞机及时地飞过了云层，侥幸避免了一场灾难。
ex.enText: The plane flew through the clouds in time and a disaster was narrowly averted.

ex.chText: 那次石油泄漏对海洋动物是一场灾难。
ex.enText: The oil spill was a disaster for sea animals.

ex.chText: 大会最终搞得一团糟。
ex.enText: The conference turned out to be a complete disaster.

ex.chText: 他们战胜了自然灾害，甚至还获得了大丰收。
ex.enText: They overcame the natural disaster and even had a bumper harvest.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，通常指各类人为或自然的灾祸，如核泄漏、洪水、暴风雪等。

ex.chText: 登山队员不幸遇到雪崩，但没有人受伤。
ex.enText: The climbers had the misfortune of running into a snowslide, but no one got hurt.

ex.chText: 厄运使她忧伤。
ex.enText: She is distressed by misfortune.

ex.chText: 我们不幸遭遇了猛烈的暴风雨。
ex.enText: We had the misfortune to run into a violent storm.

ex.chText: 我年纪还很小的时候就遭到了不幸。
ex.enText: Misfortune befell me when I was still young.

synonyms.bx: 多指较为严重的不幸，强调多由厄运或外界因素所致。

tr: an event resulting in great loss and misfortune
example: the whole city was affected by the irremediable calamity

tr: a sudden violent change in the earth's surface
a state of extreme (usually irremediable) ruin and misfortune
example: lack of funds has resulted in a catastrophe for our school system

value.def: A catastrophe is an unexpected event that causes great suffering or damage.

example.ex: From all points of view, war would be a catastrophe...
example.tran: 不管从哪方面说，战争都将是场灾难。

example.ex: If the world is to avoid environmental catastrophe, advanced economies must undergo a profound transition.
example.tran: 世界若要想避免环境灾难，经济发达的国家必须进行深刻变革。
